stories.text:
My brother is an absolute gem who loves communications hardware, radio and internet broadcast tech, cars, bikes, whiskey. I've been looking for something magical, that he will find useful and unexpected.

Over the years I've bought him: expensive whiskey or bourbon, a metal detector, radio gear, antennas.. I'm looking for something I wouldn't think of to surprise him.

Any ideas, of something you bought yourself or were gifted and love?
stories.title: Ask HN: What to get for my brother's 50th birthday?
Elon Musk’s Ultimatum: Return to the Office or Get Out
The Aurora Serverless Road Not Taken

stories.text:
Hey HN,

just wanted to show my latest project called tone to get your feedback. It is a cross platform command line audio tagger. Currently in an early state of development it already comes with a neat set of features:

- read and write support for a decent amount of fields - supports id3, mp4, flac and most other formats - chapters, covers and even custom tag fields - install one single binary - no dependencies (M1 macOS does not work atm - maybe someone can help out here)

Source code and release download:

<https://github.com/sandreas/tone>

Feedback is really appreciated.

Thanks :-)
stories.title: Show HN: Tone – a pure C# cross platform auto tagger without dependencies
Neoantigen T-Cell Receptor Gene Therapy in Pancreatic Cancer
TLP: Utility for Optimizing Linux Laptop Battery Life (Thinkpad and Others)
O_DSYNC on macOS is also broken
Your Head Hurts. But Why?: Dissonance, coherence, and labeling.
